intro: Scorodonia scorodonia, commonly known as the sweet vernal grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescence, which resembles a tuft of hair at the end of its stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Scorodonia scorodonia is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late spring. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
